```{r,echo=FALSE}
library(reticulate)
options(scipen=999)
maxopt = 12
pfix = function(c,d){
    d = d[c!=0]
    c = c[c!=0]
    p = paste0("{",c,"}x^{",d,"}",collapse="+")
    p = gsub("x^{0}","",p,fixed=T)
    p = gsub("x^{1}","x",p,fixed=T)
    p = gsub("+{-","-{",p,fixed=T)
    p = gsub("+{1}x","+x",p,fixed=T)
    p = gsub("-{1}x","-x",p,fixed=T)
    p = gsub("{-1}x","-x",p,fixed=T)
    p = gsub("{1}x","x",p,fixed=T)
    if(p==""){
        p = "0"
    }
    return(p)
}

pq = sample(-12:12,2)
p = pq[1]
q = pq[2]
ch = -12:12
fal = character()

fal = paste0("x=",ch)
fal = paste0("* $",fal,"$",collapse="\n")

sol1 = ch==p
sol2 = ch==q
sol = sol1+sol2
sol = paste0(1*(sol),collapse="")

soltxt1 = pfix(c(1,-p,-q,p*q),c(2,1,1,0))
solp = pfix(c(1,-p),c(1,0))
solq = pfix(c(1,-q),c(1,0))
solp2 = pfix(c(1,-p),c(1,0))
solq2 = pfix(c(1,-q),c(1,0))

if(solp != "x"){
    solp2 = paste0("(",solp,")")
}
if(solq != "x"){
    solq2 = paste0("(",solq,")")
}

```


Question
========

Consider the quadratic **equation** with a factored quadratic expression on the left side and zero on the right side.

$$`r solp2` `r solq2`=0$$

Using the [zero-product property](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zero-product_property) to find both solutions to the given equation.

Answerlist
--------

`r fal`



Solution
========

The [zero-product property](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zero-product_property) tells us that if a product equals 0, then at least one of the factors of the product equals 0. In this case, we know the product of $`r solp2`$ and $`r solq2`$ equals zero. This means to satisfy the equation either $`r solp`$ equals zero or $`r solq`$ equals zero. Solve each of these using addition or subtraction.

* First solution:
$$`r solp`=0$$
$$x=`r p`$$

* Second solution:
$$`r solq`=0$$
$$x=`r q`$$

Thus, the two solutions are $x=`r p`$ and $x=`r q`$.
